website_summaries.verdict: For users who don't need a large capacity coffee maker, it has some nice features and takes up a bit less space.
pros: A sleek machine with a smaller footprint than some others by the brand, but with similar features including built-in burr grinder, charcoal filtration system and thermal carafe
cons: A few complaints that the coffee doesn't brew as hot as other models, and some reports of a variety of quality concerns that pop up after a short period of time

customer_reviews.title: So hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I though the grinder and pot in one would save counter space and hassle. The grinder gets wet every time you brew coffee so you have to take the whole thing apart and dry it to make another pot. The coffee if good as long as you get the grounds into the right place but if it's even a little damp they stick and clog so you get no coffee. Picture shows how much sticks if it's dry when you start
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Use double the beans amount and drink cold coffee
customer_reviews.text: Where do I start: 1- Wastes so much coffee beans because the ground coffee gets wet and stuck 2- Coffee always have plastic taste 3- More difficult to clean then when I had a separate grinder and coffee machine 4- Coffee temperature is not hot enough from the get-go and if you let it sit in the pot for 10 minutes it gets too cold Returning :(
customer_reviews.author: Shaimaa Elk

customer_reviews.title: Carafe does NOT keep fresh coffee hot after brewing-MAJOR DRAWBACK!
customer_reviews.text: Although I am not an advocate of keeping brewed coffee hot in the carafe for an extended period time, it would be nice if this coffee maker could provide warmth to the carafe for a determined amount of time, to keep the freshly brewed coffee hot. Perhaps a timer, the consumer could set, that a heating element could keep the coffee at serving temperature. A suggestion: heating element to the carafe could be turned off or set to work, up to two (2) hours, after brewing. Other than this coffee maker is extremely difficult to clean, the flavor it provides, is stellar. If this functionality is available, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Bourghs

customer_reviews.title: 10 Cup Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we purchased. Got 7 years out of first one. Had to hunt for this model. Pricey, but sturdy. The negatives: Coffee is only moderately hot when brewed. Suggest you heat your cups and the carafe before brewing. Also; remove grinding mechanism and thoroughly clean/dry after each use or eventually you won't be able to remove the unit at all, as we found. Coffee has reasonably good flavor but grinds don't get evenly soaked, so some coffee grind waste.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMac

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect coffeemaker.
customer_reviews.text: For the past 20+ years I have used a Cuisinart coffeemaker; my first one lasted 15 years. I've been using this one for almost 2 months and I'm enjoying the fact that there is a signal to let you know if you have not put it together correctly. The grind option hasn't been used yet but so glad I read the instruction manual before I attempted to make coffee. My advice, read the manual first. The one thing that would make this coffeemaker perfect; the carafe should be glass, it keeps the coffee hotter longer. I miss my glass carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Noonie808

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is too weak
customer_reviews.text: The thermal carafe is great, the coffee it puts in, not so much. It has internal grinder that is just like the normal standalone grinder. That feeds into a mesh permanent filter. There are a bunch of parts that have to be cleaned after each use, the grinder gets moisture as it brews. All that would be ok if the coffee was decent, but I have to put in almost 2x the coffee beans, there is no way to adjust strength. I was disappointed, I bought it for the carafe wanting to be able to keep it warm or bring it with me, but the coffee taste has ruined it
customer_reviews.author: Owen M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee grinder/maker!
customer_reviews.text: Have had the same model grinder/pot for several years. Time for a new one. Buying it again! It’s the best! The thermal pot is amazing, even without “preheating” it with hot water. Perfect bean grinding every time. Love to set it up the night before. Can use the timer or just push the button for wonderful, fresh coffee quickly! Cleaning is not a problem. Wipe off (inner) surfaces and flush the pot lid every time. Not a big deal. This is the best, most efficient and most cost effective way to get coffee from freshly ground beans every day! Won’t buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Glyn

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Works just like you would expect it too. It takes a couple of pots before the factory flavor wears off but once it does it makes a great pot of coffee. The decanter holds the temperature decently but not perfectly but if you have a microwave close by you can reheat it without affecting the flavor. The water to coffee ratio is a bit weaker than I prefer when I use the grind setting but I adjust now that I know ahead of time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Seabee

customer_reviews.title: Can't brew a full pot?
customer_reviews.text: This machine was a replacement for a previous one that worked for many years. The previous one simply wore out. I liked the way this one brewed the coffee until a few months ago when it decided to stop brewing after between 2 and 4 cups were brewed (out of a full pot?). I'm giving this machine model a second chance. My warranty was gone just before this started to happen. In spite of the issues, it still makes a good cup of coffee. I'm just tired of pressing the brew button 6 times per pot.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker came highly recommended and so it may just be that we got one that was defective. But...the first thing we noticed was the condensation in the grinder area. The first few pots of coffee were fine, but after that, it was inconsistent in terms of how the coffee came out and generally came out weak. We worked on it for days, but couldn't resolve the problem and ultimately returned it. The stainless steel carafe was really nice and we will miss that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PART OF MY MORNING ROUTINE
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I've brought this mind of coffee pot. Living in the Seattle area, I am a coffee snob. YES I have had beans roasted. YES I order beans from out of state. I like this pot because it has the ability to grind whole beans every morning. That sound and that smell has become a part of my morning routine. If you use a Brita pitcher for your water in combination with the in-well filter that this coffeepot has, the taste of the coffee simply shines
customer_reviews.author: SIR KENT

customer_reviews.title: The smell of fresh coffee as you wake up!! :)
customer_reviews.text: Love fresh ground coffee in the morning!! Need to clean after every use. Easy to rinse off and let dry. Ready by evening to set up for fresh coffee the next morning. We have had this for two weeks now and the cleanup/set up routine is much faster and cleaner than using the French Press. You may need to adjust the amount of beans used depending on the coffee you use. We like Don Pablo because it is low acid and high in flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The product was good while is lasted. After 2 months it decided to stop working for no reason. I thought maybe I had an issue with my outlet but nope, the coffee machine is defective. It started smoking in fact. I called cuisinart directly and after waiting on the phone 25 minutes to talk to someone, Maureen actually, who told me they don’t have it in stock and can’t upgrade or downgrade. She said to call back in a week or two and wait on the phone again for 25 minutes and hopefully get lucky enough that they have it in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: Good price for new grind and brew. Has thermos carafe. The carafe must be pre-heated if it is to keep coffee hot for any length of time. There is no hot plate under the carafe. I have had grind and brew coffee makers with both glass carafe and hot plate and thermos and no hot plate. I prefer the former but am happy enough with this one. My old grind and brew had internal gauge to show water level. This made it easier when adding water. This machine only has external gauge, less handy when filling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer John Minnott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee
customer_reviews.text: Pro: excellent quality and durability. Easy to program. Makes excellent coffee. Excellent thermal pot. Stays hot half the day. Con: kind of a pain to clean for every pot. Used the reusable filter for a while and ended up getting paper filters. They’re just easier. Every piece has to be completely dry before setting up to use, otherwise some beans won’t grind because they stick inside the grinder. When in a hurry it’s just not quick. Also the clear cover for the grinder will stain over time. Doesn’t affect function. It’s purely cosmetic. The cup measure is for 6oz. In my 10-cup pot I get 4 decent sized mugs out of it (about 12oz)
customer_reviews.author: Renee Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great, hot, fresh grind coffee at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: After checking out the many other reviews of coffee makers, it was clear that we'd be taking a leap of faith. But we've been enjoying the Cuisinart Grind/Brew Thermal Carafe coffee maker for a 2 1/2 months without any problems. The grinder works just great, and together with the micro filter basket, delivers fresh great tasting HOT coffee. The thermal carafe keep the coffee hot for at least three hours. I only use the paper filters for the few times I brew pre-grind coffee, as its a little easier to clean up. But be prepared to wash and dry all the internal components after each brew session (a small price to pay for great coffee)
customer_reviews.author: VSH

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after two days
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this coffee machine with the built in grinder to grind coffee beans (all in one scenario), fresh ground beans and fresh coffee. We used it twice and then it quit brewing coffee even though all the other parts of the machine worked OK. The machine was returned within two days of receiving it and we purchased a different make and brand of coffee maker. A member of our family has the same coffee machine which works very well and they have no complaints. Excellent delivery and return policy from Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works great for eight months but stops working afterwards
customer_reviews.text: Works great for eight months but stops working afterwards.Sent the unit back got another unit same problem with the second unit after eight months stop sucking up the water. Had three year warranty had to pay shipping to return defective unit customer service was rude would not send return shipping lable said I must pay. I told them I am still under warranty and should not have to pay thirty dollars every eight months to send these units back when they stop working. They will not give me a refund, I am on my third unit/second replacement and last unit. I will not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like fresh ground and brewed coffee
customer_reviews.text: Just received our 3rd unit in the past 12 years. The steel pot holds the coffee hot for hours and won't break in those sink mishaps. Nothing like fresh ground and brewed coffee. We only use filtered water and have not had any issues with buildup in the heating element. Out last unit developed a pinhole in the element and would leak water from the bottom -- there are not parts available for that repair. Our machine works no less than one pot for each day. An average 5-7 year life is what I expect and the DGB-650BC has lived up to that. Good quality. Clean it after each use and never have an issue with clogged grinds.
customer_reviews.author: MikeR

customer_reviews.title: Not so Hot!
customer_reviews.text: Dislike that the grind level cannot be changed, bean capacity is limited and that impacts the flavor and strength of coffee, coffee is not and does not stay hot in the pot, awkward pouring coffee from pot as the top has to be removed to pour without spill. I ordered a stainless steel insulated coffee press and coffee taste much better and stays hot for up to 45 minutes. Giving the cuisinart away to someone who has fewer requirements and expectations for their morning cup of java.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Definitely has its issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Cuisinart Thermal Grind and Brew about 3.5 years ago. Used semi-regularly. Grinder works well, but steam from the coffee brewer makes the grinding area terrible to clean. The thermal carafe is definitely the best part of the machines. A month ago I started noticing puddles under the coffee maker. After inspecting it looks like there is probably a leak somewhere on the heating mechanism and it has rusted all the way through as seen in picture. It’s a good idea with some serious design and function issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Musson

customer_reviews.title: Impressive And Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee pot. It produces coffee with great flavor and unlike some of the other reviewer‘s I find it to be piping hot and stay that way in the stainless steel carafe for quite some time. I love the programmable option and I am thrilled to wake up to piping hot coffee at 6 AM each day. I find cleaning the pot a simple process each morning that takes me less than five minutes including the well where the beans are ground. I rinse it out and make sure it is completely dry before replacing it, and I have had absolutely no problems with the beans sticking together.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy T.

customer_reviews.title: What happened to HOT coffee?
customer_reviews.text: The previous model, DGB-600bc, was a very good grind and brew coffee maker. This one is NOT. The coffee is weak and not hot. Cuisinart's fix is the 1-4 cup setting. This setting makes no difference. Cuisinart also suggests filling the caraf with hot water prior to making coffee. This defeats the purpose of setting the timer and waking up to a HOT cup of coffee. Are you listening Cuisinart? If you are looking for a strong, hot cup of coffee keep looking. Cuisinart's DGB-650BC does not deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D

customer_reviews.title: Unit stopped working in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've owned. The first lasted two almost three years then the internals broke. and because the unit is a good design, Great features ...just what we where looking for., we bought a second. But the replacement for the first unit has only lasted 10 months. The second unit just will not heat water...wont initiate brew... $85 for less than a year of service...residential family use. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor, but..
customer_reviews.text: Love having automatic fresh ground beans ready in the AM.. its the best alarm clock. But what a mess to clean. The humidity from water tank and bean dust seem to gum with and make tar in the grinder hopper. The most disappointing thing is that it is not hot enough when brewed and looses heat quickly. I was expecting the thermos to stay hot for at least 45-60 min. But at least it wont break. More maintenance than a cheap ol glass carafe machine, which I may go back to. Only plus this unit has is the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Will Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Ummm??
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because they returned it without the original box. Not sure if we got a malfunctioning item, but this thing just would not make coffee. We used up to 10 scoops of high quality coffee beans with just a couple cups of water and it's still only made hot water with a slight coffee taste. So strange!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Reed

customer_reviews.title: Weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: I’m drinking more coffee while working from home so thought I would treat myself to freshly ground good coffee and save $ (currently using Nespresso which is about $1/cup). This is my 3rd grind and brew...however I am very dissatisfied with this version. As others have stated, the coffee is weak no matter what I do. Previous versions had a manual knob to adjust strength of coffee. There is no reserve hopper for beans as previous versions. Carafe doesn’t keep the coffee hot for very long. I’m going to contact amazon to see what my options are....
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Very good price and very good coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker! The reason for the 4-star rating is simply that I’ve only had it for a few weeks and can’t make an honest review of durability or material quality (although nothing about it screams cheap and shabby). I would certainly recommend this coffe maker w/ grinder to any one that loves fresh ground coffee. Tip: Clean and dry the grinder part after every use. Update: Have now had this coffee grinder/maker for 9 months. No issues at all. LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Pyhtila

customer_reviews.title: and start to leak or we do something bad to them
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these I have purchased, because they wear out after a while, and start to leak or we do something bad to them. Easy to set up, and the timer feature is great. Keeps coffee hot for several hours, particularly if you rinse carafe with hot water before making coffee (obviously not when using the timer). Past carafes have dribbled but it looks like Cuisinart fixed the design; we no longer have to pour over the sink. If you are not a super coffee snob and just need morning caffeine, this is a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: PB Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, but lasted only 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee make six months ago and it produced a decent pot of coffee every morning until today when it stopped brewing. So now I'm the proud owner of a very large, bulky, inefficient coffee grinder. Admittedly, for the $130 price I paid for this all-in-one grinder/coffee maker I guess I shouldn't be too surprised by the short life-span, but I thought I would at least have gotten a year of life out of it (if not more). In short - if you're feeling like this premium coffee maker deal is too good to be true, that's because it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ben D.

customer_reviews.title: Weak Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I hadn't thrown the box away otherwise this maker would have been returned. It produces the weakest coffee I've ever experienced. We would fill the grinder basket to where it's almost spilling over. We would only add 5 cups or less of water and it's still weak. Something is not right and I'm bummed! I need my morning coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Clark

customer_reviews.title: Cusinart coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: The one only feature I do not like is that the burner does not keep the coffee hot when you make a full carafe of coffee, otherwise, it's a very functional coffee brewer! Better than Keurig I might add and I've had to replace them, hence I've owned three of them. I have a refurbished Cusinart coffee brewer that I've had for over 10 years and it still functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Girlfinn1

customer_reviews.title: I've had this for two years
customer_reviews.text: Except for the fact that it scares the crap out of me when it starts up at 7 am each morning, it's great. Of course, it only makes coffee as good as the quality of beans you put into it, but we love having fresh ground coffee in the morning. It's well-built and we've had no problems with it in two years.
customer_reviews.author: Halef and Michael

customer_reviews.title: What a POS.
customer_reviews.text: First, the design is so inefficient it uses twice as many beans as what would normally be required for a typical cup of coffee. That gets expensive. Second, it's utterly frustrating to use if you're attempting to make more than half a pot because randomly at times, the works just seem to jam up. The last thing I need to hear is the "finished" beep going off and all that's in the pot is hot, clear water, and the filter swimming with un-dripped coffee. An absolute horridly designed piece of junk. I'm tossing mine off my roof when it stops raining.
customer_reviews.author: UnfilteredDregs

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: I have had the pot four a couple months. It makes a great cup of coffee! (As always the quality of bean and water maters) The thermal carafe keeps coffee hot enough to serve for 3 hours or so (probably longer if it is left full) without having to burn the coffee by continuing to apply heat. I had an earlier model of this pot for several years and they have improved the pour spout to significantly reduce dripping. I am tempted to buy another to have on hand for when this one breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I ❤️ this grind and brew coffee maker. Could have spent a lot more but why? I’ll never know. Just what I need and wanted. So far so wonderful. I am now an official coffee snob!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: My previous Cuisinart Grind and Brew gave up after 15 - 20 years of faithful service. The new machine adds a visible water level and a better pourer on the jug. Brilliant design and function and great value. I love Cuisinart
customer_reviews.author: Isthmuse

customer_reviews.title: Brews great flavored coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Bought refurbished Grind and Brew. Price was amazing, delivered early, coffee is excellent and carafe prevents air/light from effecting flavor with time. Had a question for seller and it was addressed immediately and with great customer service. Very happy with product and process. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hardman

customer_reviews.title: Like Strong Coffee?
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good coffee maker except if you like strong coffee. Ours has overflowed a dozen times until we figured out how to grind the beans first, turn it off, fill the filter almost to the top with pre-ground coffee, then brew with the grinder off. You can only add enough beans to fill the filter about halfway, which results in week coffee. The amount of ground coffee used has to be just right. I wouldn't buy this kind of coffee maker again, too complicated, but easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Ultra easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade to my current coffee prep routine, which was a Chemex pour-over and manually grinding beans. Very satisfied with this purchase! When I bought this, the two most important features were 1) ease to clean and 2) ability to grind beans. I've used it for about a week now and it meets my expectations for both. Highly recommend this as someone's first coffee machine, especially if grinding beans is important.
customer_reviews.author: Kaydie

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is not honored.
customer_reviews.text: I like the grind and brew feature. The coffee could be a little hotter. After 3 months of use the unit quit brewing. The grind feature still worked but it would not brew any coffee. After several calls to the warranty department the agreed to replace it in 2- 3 weeks. Not the best customer service. After waiting over one month I still have not received a replacement or even a date when I can expect one. When I asked for a refund I was told they cannot do that. It seems they do not care once the item has been sold.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker We've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: While looking up this coffee maker on Amazon to recommend to a friend, I was surprised to discover we purchased it in February of 2012. We've gotten almost 8 years of delicious coffee from this machine! We do not use the programmable feature as I've read stale water can lower the quality of taste in coffee. We also use a paper basket filter inside the gold-tone filter which simplifies clean-up. All parts are top-rack dishwasher safe. If our machine does finally quit working, we will immediately buy another one. I hope Cuisinart does not discontinue this model.
customer_reviews.author: EDWIN SABRACK

customer_reviews.title: It's good but has some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I like it but there are quite a few steps to clean it which can be frustrating when you are in a hurry. If you forget to clean it, it gets caked on. Also it always leaks when I pour the coffee for some reason. It does not have a heating element to keep it warm either which is a tad frustrating. It does make fresh coffee though which is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Ilovebling

customer_reviews.title: Decent coffee, NOT very hot coffee and hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the great reviews. It makes a decent cup of coffee and doesn’t take up much counter space. What I don’t like is that it does NOT make the coffee hot enough. The machine also turns off once it has brewed but in my opinion, the coffee isn’t hot enough in the beginning and then doesn’t stay hot in the insulted carafe. It’s also very hard to clean- I can’t fit my hand inside the carafe to scrub it and you have to clean the grinder even if you don’t use it because it gets a ton of condensation. Ultimately, I would return this if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Beth Ellis

customer_reviews.title: It took a few tries to figure out the perfect combination of scoops to water
customer_reviews.text: The machine worked well at first, but the more and more we used it, the less beans would actually be ground up. The clean-up is a process as well as everything is moist and the grinds get everywhere. It took a few tries to figure out the perfect combination of scoops to water. The machine itself is compact and easy to use, but I think I will avoid machines that grind and brew from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Eyzengart

customer_reviews.title: Great concept. Absolute piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Absolute piece of junk. The first one we got didn't keep good time so the timed brewing function was worthless. The heat from the steam warped the lid and the machine would shut itself off unless you stood over it to hold the lid down. We replaced it. The replacement had the exact same problems only, to add insult to injury, the coffee grinder would often clog, causing the water to back up into the machine and to turn the coffee grounds to cement inside. Absolute waste of $100 and a surprising disappointment from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it! Coffee is either cold or burnt...never tastes good. Had an older version and the coffee was always amazing and stayed warm for hours. This one has no reheat option and if you put a little too much water in or have some forgotten leftover coffee in the pot it continues to brew and spills out all over the place. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Franco

customer_reviews.title: How to fix if it won't grind
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Cuisinart DGB-650BC Grind-and-Brew Thermal 10-Cup Automatic Coffeemaker. The first last 5 years. Our second is 7 years old. When it recently stopped grinding, I added a stainless steel screw to the top plunger which activates the spring-loaded contact mechanism. Back in the coffee business!
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Grinder design is lacking
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes a good cup of coffee. It sounds great to just add beans and brew. However the grinder is poorly designed because it gets wet during the brewing process. You cannot brew again (with whole beans) unless the grinder is completely dry. So forget a 2nd pot. You have to remember to remove the grinder and let it dry before brewing again. Too bad; I like Cuisnart coffee makers and grinders (I have owned both), but this product is not up to what I expect from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use fresh ground coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one the first one died after 7 years of use. I love having fresh ground coffee in the morning. It is a bit loud while grinding however it’s only for a approx 1.5 -2 minutes. I would recommend to wash it after each grind as the directions suggest - otherwise it can get gunned with bean residue. I would highly recommend this coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lombardi

customer_reviews.title: Basic machine, works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good cup of coffee, it's hot if the carafe is warmed before- does not keep hot for hours like I wanted. The grinder works well but condensation does get into it making it need frequent cleaning and it is a very loud for a grinder. There is no extra programming for this machine, it's pretty basic but works well and brews the coffee fast. Overall it's decent but I'm not absolutely loving it....
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee pot ever
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the exact same model that finally died after THIRTEEN years. We only use Starbucks French Roast beans for our coffee. Place the beans in the pot, it grinds them and deposits the grinds into the filter area and in about 10 minutes, we have freshly brewed coffee.
customer_reviews.author: raymont1944

customer_reviews.title: Broke after couple months of uses. Coffee comes out super light
customer_reviews.text: Not even a couple months into owning this coffee machine did it start giving me issues and giving me light coffee. I ended up fixing it and it worked again for about 2 more months and now it’s at the point that there is nothing I can do, it just makes super light and gross coffee. I typically make my coffee strong so there’s no reason for it to come out like this. I’ve done everything to fix it and it’s still giving me the same issue. I’ve wasted so many good bags of coffee 😖
customer_reviews.author: Scott Gorgies

customer_reviews.title: Not hot enough
customer_reviews.text: Everything else about this coffeemaker is fine so far, but the coffee doesn't brew nearly hot enough. Which is kind of the point. Very disappointed. The manual suggests "pre-heating" the carafe with hot water, which helps a little, but is an inconvenience and wastes a pot of water. The coffee doesn't stay hot for topping off my cup through the morning. The Cuisinart that I had previously (and loved for 8 years) had a hot plate, so I assumed this one did, too. I spent a lot of time deciding which new maker to buy, so I'm disappointed that now I'm stuck with this one.
customer_reviews.author: AMT1982

customer_reviews.title: THe best
customer_reviews.text: Worth the extra for the thermal carafe. Bean grinding is precise. Great to awaken to a pot of freshly ground and flavorful hot coffee. Our previous unit lasted almost 20 years with gentle care. Hope this one lasts the same.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyScottsdale

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great coffee maker. Went from using pods after my grinder died and forgot how good fresh brewed was. This machine is great. As stated on other reviews it is easy to clean and operate. You can make a pot for the price of a couple of pods.Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: H Marine

customer_reviews.title: It makes excellent coffee. I particularly like the carafe
customer_reviews.text: It makes excellent coffee. I particularly like the carafe, which keeps the coffee nice and warm for a couple of hours. Two things you should be aware of: 1) the grinder is not a ceramic burr but is metal 2) there are 7 different parts, all of which must be cleaned after every use. The parts, however, can be washed in the dishwasher. Assembling and disassembling are probably very good for fine tuning your brain.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Ortiz-Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffeemaker recommend highly!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee/grinder with timer coffee maker. I have had a lot of coffee makers this so far is the best. Weve had it for a few months and I still look fwd to getting up to the smell of fresh ground coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Susswo

customer_reviews.title: Starry, Starry Mornings
customer_reviews.text: As a lifelong nighthawk, this mechanism became a must-have in my life when my teaching schedule changed from evening classes to 100% morning classes. Yikes. I love being able to program this before I go to bed. Even better: I get to wake up to a hot, fresh cup of coffee----which I can smell all the way in my bedroom. This grinds evenly, comes with a gold filter (perfect; very eco-friendly), and keeps coffee hot for hours. Only complaint: there is no way to re-heat the pot...though,wait a minute...I've never actually read the directions. Hmmmm....this ***may*** actually be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Veggie Chel

customer_reviews.title: Steam gets inside of Grinder: Terrible Design
customer_reviews.text: Steam enters the grinder shoot and clogs it up. Steam also gets into the chamber where the coffee beans site making it a mess to clean. The grinding system also has to be cleaned for each use. The amount of the coffee beans that fit in the chamber is limited. We like strong coffee and due to the limited chamber size had to brew very small pots at a time. We are returning and sticking with a separate grinder and coffee part. This is a burdensome machine for the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn’t the same.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Grind and Brew, this was my third purchase. Sadly, the quality is not the same. Lighter materials and the grinds go all over the basket lid. Truly disappointed in Cuissart for the changes.
customer_reviews.author: SandiW

customer_reviews.title: Nothing bad to say
customer_reviews.text: Love having fresh ground coffee in the morning so decided to give this a try. I love it easy to use easy to clean nothing bad to say. I also love that you can set a timer for it to brew the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Lazy coffee lover loves this.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect machine for someone who loves coffee, can appreciates freshly ground beans, but doesn't want a mess and a ton of gadgets. Easy to use and program. While I'm always on my grind, I love that I have the option of turning this machine's grind off. I would recommend opening the top components after brew is done so that the steam can dry, otherwise the grounds pile up and it's annoying to clean. Generally not annoying to clean. Has on a few occasions spilled everywhere while brewing (thus the 4 stars not 5), but if you keep it clean and put all the pieces together correctly it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Warm and weak coffee!
customer_reviews.text: Originally I was going to give it 4 stars, however not only is the coffee not hot enough (I Nuke it for 30 seconds) but it is weak. I tried making it stronger by using less water. That did not help. It is likely I will stop using it soon and go back to poor overs,
customer_reviews.author: daniel goldfrank

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker; until it malfunctioned
customer_reviews.text: I loved this coffee maker and have been calling Cuisinart for a replacement since it malfunctioned. I regret purchasing because now I've been waiting for a month for a replacement and have called multiple times with no direct answers from Cuisinart reps. Basically one morning the grinder would not stop grinding that the item started smoking - every time you plug it in the grinder just keeps grinding. Go spend your money on a different coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy to use, and good
customer_reviews.text: My parents needed a new coffee machine because their old one broke. I did them a favor and bought this for them and because I'm not a coffee drinker, so I never use it. It's been maybe a year plus since we've had it, and there are no complaints from my parents.
customer_reviews.author: This Guy

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite coffee maker!
customer_reviews.text: We love our Cuisinart coffee maker!This one grinds the coffee beans when you are ready for coffee. It always tastes fresh and is so easy to operate. We could only find this particular make on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee maker, while it lasts
customer_reviews.text: This has a lifespan of about 5 years with daily use. We got our first one for our wedding in 2006. That one died in 2011. Now it's 2016 and I'm shopping again because the controls are totally on the fritz. It no longer grinds and only brews randomly. Turns on and off by itself. When it's new, it makes great coffee and our guests always compliment how good our coffee tastes, even with non-premium beans. It is a bit of a pain to clean everyday, but I will still order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped brewing properly after two months.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker never worked very well, the timer never functioned properly to start the coffee at a certain time in the morning, despite my following the directions exactly. I could live with that and with the fairly mediocre coffee it made. But after two month of moderate use (about 5 pots of coffee a week), the water stopped filling the coffee basket correctly and all I ended up getting was light-brown water. I'll try to attach a photo. Amazon won't accept a return now, so into the trash it goes, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: ACH

customer_reviews.title: makes weak coffee (due to not holding enough beans) and is hard to clean out.
customer_reviews.text: 1) grinder does not hold enough beans for strong coffee, so coffee comes out a little weak if you plan on making a full pot. 2) there is no "strong" button on this model. 3) grinder does not grind beans fine enough. 4) water gets inside grinder making it difficult to clean. while grind and brew sounds convenient, this coffee pot is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kawwa

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this machine
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this machine. However after a week of tepid weak tasting coffee I had to send it back. I know the carafe keeps the coffee warm, however it never gets "hot" in the first place. Disappointing. Also the flavor is very weak. Perhaps if you could control the grind and make it finer that may help. You can't though resulting in flavorless coffee. I tried many things to get the flavor up. Nothing worked. Im back to a grinder and drip for now. Sorry I couldn't like it its a nice idea for the price. Its just useless if you like coffee.
customer_reviews.author: skillet34

customer_reviews.title: Wet coffee grounds stick to every part of the pot.
customer_reviews.text: Inside of coffee pot is always moist and the grounds are wet and do not make it from grinder to basket. The entire coffee pot must be taken apart and cleaned and dried after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaking coffee while brewing
customer_reviews.text: We've had this coffee maker for five months now. It was wonderful at first, bit over the last week it has started to just leak coffee all over the counter while brewing it. I think it's probably a problem with the lid off the carafe, but when I check everything for obvious causes, I can't find anything. Looks just fine until you try to make coffee again. I don't see a return or refund option anywhere, so I will just have to swallow the loss of $99 for a coffee maker that doesn't work after five months and get an old school cheap glass carafe-one at the store today.
customer_reviews.author: Ricola

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: I have used these Grind and brew makers for a long time, and this one meets the needs perfectly. Cleaning takes time, but I’m used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rabe

customer_reviews.title: problems
customer_reviews.text: Water and grounds over flowing has been a recurring problem when trying to brew a full amount. Using distilled water and having to redo it, so I am not pleased with this result.
customer_reviews.author: Azoraa

customer_reviews.title: Clean basket nightmare 😣
customer_reviews.text: We have had this coffee pot since February 2 2019 (today is October 5, 2019). There is a clean basket feature that will not clear and we have to unplug the pot and leave it unplugged for overnight in order for the feature to clear. Cleaning our old Cuisinart was so much easier and the entire system worked better. I will be contacting the manufacturer to see about getting a new system and getting rid of this cleaning headache.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Carr

customer_reviews.title: 4 weeks in and it’s broken already
customer_reviews.text: I had this item for a little over 4 weeks and it broke. The grinder will not stop grinding even when it is in off mode. I have to actually unplug the machine to get it to stop. The coffee does not have a good flavor it is almost bland tasting and I have tried a variety of different brands of whole coffee beans. I even tried using ground coffee and it caused the machine to back up and over flow causing a mess. Do not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie Matherly

customer_reviews.title: Everything I was hoping for and more
customer_reviews.text: I love the option of grind and brew or just brew, sometimes I want the silent option in the morning. Though, I’ve definitely come to enjoy fresh ground better. Coffee stays hot for hours also.
customer_reviews.author: BBOS

customer_reviews.title: Weak coffee & need to fill grounds/bean every pot
customer_reviews.text: We had to send our back. There's no way to change the strength and each pot, no matter how big or small or how many beans were put in the grinder, came out weak. Not clear but could be seen thru while pouring. That's weak! Pretty inconvenient to have to fill the grinder before every pot and you can't fill the grinder until all the parts are ALL THE WAY dry after rinsing out. Just messed with my flow.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Luczak

customer_reviews.title: 5 star appliance
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is great! It arrived exactly as described, with minimal effort needed to figure it out. Makes delicious coffee, with fresh ground beans every pot! Also, it's a nice looking appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Plumb-Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: That it makes coffee
customer_reviews.text: The worst .12.00 coffee pot works better.IVE TRIED EVERY THING THE COFFEE IS LIKE DIRTY WATER THE GRINDER IS A JOKE WASTE OFMONEY ALL THE WAY AROUND ALL ITS GOOD FOR IS HOT EATER DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY .I had to by a 20.00 coffee maker it’s great
customer_reviews.author: DESIREE MENDES

customer_reviews.title: Coffee is wonderful in this machine
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these coffee makers i ahve had. As soon as the first one died I ordered an new one. Coffee is wonderful in this machine. I love it. Hope this one lasts the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Roane

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these. I like coffee that comes from freshly ground beans. I have used this coffee maker for years. It’s up to you to buy the best beans.
customer_reviews.author: nora

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst coffee maker I have ever owned. I had a previous model for about 5 years. It was wonderful. This one does not allow you to make the coffee as flavorful as you would like, even after cleaning the coffee area it stays moist and this morning the coffee overflowed creating an enormous mess! I feel that they took a great product and cheapened it so down that it is worthless. I wish I had read reviews but I didn’t because I was so happy with the old model.
customer_reviews.author: Randi Russell

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother as a Christmas gift. The heating element underneath did not work. We contacted cuisinart and they stated that since hers was the only one that was broken (in other words no one else had had that issue) that we would have to pay for repair as well as shipping and handling. Horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: tlfields

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago and have been pretty unhappy with it. I owned a Cuisinart brew/grind once that last for several years. So my hopes where high. This machine does not grind the beans down enough to make strong coffee. You have to use a different grinder if you want any potency at all. Now after a year, the water stops brewing and I have to "turn off grind" and then hit the power button to finish it up. Lots of clean up parts too. Don't buy this product.....you won't be happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Langley

customer_reviews.title: Makes terrible, weak coffee. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. If I hadn't thrown away the packaging already I would return this. It makes terribly weak coffee and there's no way to adjust the grind or the brew strength. It has 6 parts that must be removed, washed and dried between each brewing. The basket that holds the whole coffee beans is so small that you cannot get enough beans in the basket for full 10 cups. A real mistake and I wish I hadn't bought it.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker shuts off as soon as it’s done brewing, so the coffee gets cold quickly. It’s recommended to put hot water in the carafe before brewing to heat it up, a waste of water and time. Sadly, after two months, this coffee maker short circuited while brewing and almost caused a fire in our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Brewed the first batch and it was just as good as drinking water. Instructions say "1 scoop to one cup water" well.... yeah, if you want coffee that tastes almost like water! Fine! We doubled the bean ration and still... not even half way there and I don't even like strong/dark coffee. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: There’s like 8 steps just to make the coffee. I don’t know why they wouldn’t make it so that the grinder seals so it doesn’t get steam in it every use. There are too many parts to clean and put together. We drink coffee daily and this thing is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shipe

customer_reviews.title: For the price you can do better.
customer_reviews.text: Brews a good cup but heat/steam warps closing lid which causes it not to close properly. Makes it not depress a button needed to brew without error. About 18 months of use 2-3 pots a week. Also the grinding unit takes in moisture and makes very difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Your going to love it
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing like fresly grinded coffee any time of day. This is my fourth Cuisinart grind and brew coffee maker. The last three had a glass carafe which I thought was great, but the stainless steel pot is a major improvement. For one thing, the power turns off as soon as the coffee is brewed so it does not continue cooking. I have found that if I fill the pot with hot water for a few minutes before brewing, the coffee stays hot and fresh for five or six hours. I have one in both of my homes......they are the best.....p
customer_reviews.author: L.C

customer_reviews.title: Clogged Grinder Every Time - Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart makes fantastic products . I believe however this coffee maker is probably one of the worst products I have ever used and after 10 days I am returning . I highly do not recommend purchasing the grinder clogs immediately and you are constantly having to unclog. The 12 cup maker is a much better bet had that unit for 7 years before it died and once I return this unit am going back to the 12 cup. Grateful Amazon has such a good return policy.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS COFFEE MAKER!!! REALLY!!
customer_reviews.text: Believe the reviews that say It is impossible to make a strong cup of coffee with this machine. I wish I had!! The machine literally can not hold enough coffee beans or ground coffee for the amount of water it holds. You can NEVER make a full pot of coffee. I get by now by making no more than 6 cups at a time using ground coffee. When using coffee beans, I can't make more than 4 cups!! Grrrrr, so frustrating! Wish I had returned the machine for a refund. DO NOT BUY THIS COFFEE MAKER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin LH

customer_reviews.title: Broke after just 7 months...
customer_reviews.text: Can a coffeemaker "do it all" ? As it turns out, no. No wonder it's discontinued! What a waste of money. Pro: makes good tasting coffee. Cons: bad design, ridiculously hard to clean & fill, coffee not "piping hot". We are smart, careful people but there are just too many ways for this coffeemaker to f* up. Read the bad reviews & take them seriously, I wish we had done.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: NOT Easy to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe there were reviews that said this was "easy to clean." Many parts that need to be cleaned out each day. Will be replacing with a standard coffee maker. We've had issues with repeated beeping and the heating element. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: I also like the external water level indicator
customer_reviews.text: We got about eight years out of the older model of this, but the grinder wasn't working well anymore and, even when we used pre-ground coffee, it would inexplicably jam up where the carafe and and the grinds' basket connect and spill coffee all over the kitchen counter and floor. But it had lasted so long we didn't think twice about getting another one. And the new model is much improved over the old. The big thing is, the grinder is quieter. I also like the external water level indicator, a more secure door for the grind compartment as well as some other minor improvements. And it does make a great cup of coffee! We're very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine... but the lid
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love coffee and this machine makes a great cup of coffee! I love that you can use whole bean or ground and the pot keeps the coffee hot for a while. However... the lid keeps breaking! A piece from the back broke off and we super glued it back. Now another chunk of the lid has broken off and it's very frustrating. I don't want to have to buy a whole new coffee maker when the only issue is the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Wells

customer_reviews.title: Ok for when we have guests
customer_reviews.text: This uses a lot of beans. Even though my espresso machine is more work I use that instead of this bc it uses up a lot of beans to get a full bodied flavor
customer_reviews.author: Kalani R.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hot and fresh, but the easiest to clean
customer_reviews.text: Coffee maker works really well, timer is easy to set. I like having the grinder in the maker, keeps things simple and fresh, but because the grinder is actually inside it gets wet from steam and the dust from coffee gets a bit muddy making it not the easiest to clean (and the grinder cap has a few corners to dig in). Once it is clean and dry, it's great and if course coffee stays hot without burning.
customer_reviews.author: Mtber

product_meta.title: Cuisinart DGB-650BC Grind-and-Brew Thermal 10-Cup Automatic Coffeemaker, Brushed Metal
product_meta.description:
Style:Thermal Carafe| Size:10-Cup

GRIND AND BREW COFFEEMAKER
Retire your alarm clock and wake up instead to the rich aroma of freshly ground, just brewed coffee, with the Cuisinart Grind & Brew Automatic Coffeemaker. This deluxe 10-cup model offers the best of Cuisinart's expert coffeemaking technology to deliver unsurpassed ease of use and rich full-bodied coffee flavor. With streamlined thermal carafe, it's a beautiful addition to any kitchen.

A perfect addition to any modern kitchen, this 10-cup automatic coffeemaker grinds whole beans right before brewing to produce a fresh and flavorful pot of coffee. The 24-hour fully programmable unit works great for "wake-up" coffee or having coffee ready when it's time to serve dessert--without getting up from the table. In addition, its brew-pause function makes it simple to sneak a cup before the end of the brewing cycle. 

The Grind & Brew Coffeemaker features a separate grinding assembly and filter chamber to make beans easy to add and used grounds easy to remove. A convenient "grind off" control turns the grinder off when preground coffee is used. 

Smaller amounts can be brewed without any loss of flavor thanks to the units 1- to 4-cup setting. For added convenience, the coffeemaker provides a large control panel, adjustable automatic shut-off from zero to four hours, and a 10-cup (5 ounces each) double-wall thermal carafe with a generous stay-cool handle and drip-free pouring spout. 

Accessories include a gold-tone commercial-style permanent filter and a charcoal water filter for removing impurities. The sleek-looking coffeemaker measures 12 by 9-4/5 by 17-1/2 inches and carries a three-year limited warranty.

A charcoal water filter and a permanent commercial-style gold tone coffee filter allow only pure flavor to flow through, and the popular Brew Pause feature lets you sneak a cup before the cycle is finished. 

PRODUCT PARTS AND BENEFITS
 1.  Reservoir Cover with Release Button
     Flips back for easy filling of the water reservoir and access to the grinder compartment. 
     
     
 2.  Showerhead
     Distributes water evenly over coffee, reducing temperature loss as water passes through grounds. 
     
     
 3.   
 4.  Control Panel
     
     
      * Clock/LCD Display
        Displays time of day and Auto On times. 
      * On/Off button with LED Indicator
        Manually turns coffeemaker on or off. 
      * Audible Tone
        An audible tone sounds 5 times when brew cycle is complete. 
      * 1-4 Cup Setting
        Improves extraction, flavor and temperature when brewing fewer than 5 cups. 
      * Hour and Minute Buttons
        Use to program clock and Auto On function. 
      * Grind Off Button with LED Indicator
        Turns off the grinder when using pre-ground coffee. 
      * Program Button with LED Indicator
        Sets and/or displays programmed Auto On time. 
     
     
     
     
 5.   
 6.  Filter Basket Compartment
     
     
      * Filter Basket
      * Filter Basket Cover
      * Cuisinart Gold Tone Commercial (Dishwasher Safe)
      * Style Filter
     
     
     
     
 7.  Filter Basket Door
     
     
 8.  Filter Basket Door Release Button
     
     
 9.  Brew Pause
     Stops flow of coffee from basket when carafe is removed from resting plate, so a cup can be poured in mid-brew, if desired. 
     
     
 10. Measuring Scoop with Brush
     
     
 11. Thermal Carafe with Hands-Free Lid
     An easy-pour, dripless, double-wall insulated 10-cup thermal carafe with ergonomic handle. Coffee berws through and pours through a unique lid that seals out air to preserve fresh-brewed flavor. No need to turn or adjust lid.
     
     

 10.  Cord Storage
     
     
 11. Resting Plate
     Scratch resistant with nonstick coating 
     
     
 12. #4 Basket Paper Filters included
     
     
 13. Water Reservoir with Water Level Indicator
     
     
 14. Charcoal Water Filter
     Charcoal water filter eliminates chlorine, bad tastes and odors from tap water. 
     
     
 15. BPA Free
     All materials that come in contact with coffee or water are BPA free. 
     
     
 16.  Grinder Basket Lid
     Use the recess on each side of the lid to remove lid for easy addition of beans. Note: Lid must be in place for unit to operate. 
     
     
 17. Grinder Basket
     
     


SPECIAL FEATURES


 * Automatically grinds whole beans before brewing
 * 24-hour fully programmable
 * 10-cup (5 ounces each) double-wall insulated thermal carafe
 * Brew Pause™ feature lets you enjoy a cup before brewing has finished
 *  Automatically shuts off when brewing is complete 
 * Grind-off feature
 * 1 to 4-cup feature
 * Gold tone commercial style permanent filter
 * Charcoal water filter removes impurities
 * Limited 3-year warranty



THE PERFECT CUP OF COFFEE
Element 1: Water
Coffee is 98% water. The quality of that water is as important as the quality of your coffee. If water doesn't taste good from the tap, it won't taste good in your coffee. That's why Cuisinart has added a water filter to the Grind & Brew Coffeemaker. The charcoal filter removes chlorine, bad tastes, and odors, for the purest coffee flavor, every time you brew. 

Element 2: Coffee
While coffee is 98% water, all of the flavor comes from the beans. To achieve the same great taste you enjoy at a coffee bar, you need to use the same quality of coffee. 

Buy the beans fresh and whole, only about two weeks' supply at a time for maximum freshness. Once the coffee bean is broken, its flavor degrades very quickly. That's why the Grind & Brew grinds your coffee just prior to brewing. If it is not practical to buy small supplies, separate larger amounts of beans into one to two week portions immediately after purchase, and freeze them in airtight containers. 

The best way to maximize freshness is to minimize exposure to air, light, and moisture. So, once beans have been removed from the freezer, maintain them in a sealed container at room temperature, since damaging condensation occurs every time the beans are removed from the freezer or refrigerator. Note that some coffee experts advise against freezing dark-roast beans, because freezing can cause the oils to coagulate. Other experts disagree. We suggest you experiment and decide for yourself.

Element 3: Grind
The grind is critical for proper flavor extraction. If the grind is too fine, over-extraction and bitterness will result. Too fine a grind may also clog the filter. If grind is too coarse, the water will pass through too quickly and the maximum flavor will not be extracted. The Grind & Brew is preset for a medium grind, the optimal grind for this type of coffeemaker. 

Element 4: Proportion
Coffee that is too strong or too weak is always a disappointment. Follow the recommended portions of ground coffee in the instructions included with every Grind & Brew, and later adjust the amount to suit your taste. The Grind & Brew makes up to twelve (12) 5-ounce cups of coffee
feature_bullets: 10-Cup automatic coffeemaker with built-in automatic bean grinder
Fully programmable with Auto shut off, Brew Pause, 1- to 4-Cup setting, and grind-off option for pre-ground coffee
Double-wall thermal stainless-steel carafe keeps coffee hot and fresh. BPA free
Includes: Charcoal water filter and permanent gold tone filter ensures only the freshest coffee flavor flows through. Measuring scoop, instruction Booklet
